descriptions.title: An Overview of Muli
descriptions.content: Sent by the third Dalai Lama in the 1580s to propagate Buddhism, Chökyi Sanggyé Gyatso (chos kyi sangs rgyas rgya mtsho) named himself the first dharma king of Muli (mu li). The kingdom’s religious affairs were under the direct leadership of the Dalai Lamas and the Three Great Monastic Seats (gdan sa gsum) in Lhasa, whereas its political affairs were largely under the control of the Qing. In 1729 the Qing government granted the title of Pacification Commissioner (anfusi, 安抚司) to the sixth king Lopsang Tupten (blo bzang thub bstan), and in 1868 it granted the title of xuanweisi on the thirteenth king Sönam Trashi (bsod nams bkra shis).
